blak3980

Class Poly

  • java.lang.Object
    • blak3980.Poly

  • public class Poly
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines polynomial objects. It contains a array of int objects, each of which represents a polynomial monomial. Thus coefficients can be explicitly addressed through their exponent. All elements of the coeffs array must have a int object defined - thus there is no need to check for null array elements when processing the array.
    Author:
    Tyler Blakeley 090603980 Blak3980@mylaurier.ca

    • Constructor Detail

      • Poly

        public Poly(int degree)
        Creates a new Poly object of degree degree. All elements of the coeffs array contain a int object with a coefficient of 0. The index of each element matches the exponent of its int object. The number of elements in the coeffs array is one greater than the degree of the polynomial, in order to store the exponents from 0 to degree .
        Parameters:
        degree - the Poly degree.

      • Poly

        public Poly(Poly that)
        Creates a new Poly with content identical to another Poly object.
        Parameters:
        that - The Poly whose contents are to be copied into this Poly.

      • Poly

        public Poly(java.lang.String str,
    java.lang.String var)
     throws PolyException,
            OperatorException
        Creates a Poly based upon a string representation of a polynomial. Not all terms need be explicitly represented in the input string.
        Parameters:
        str - The string representation of a polynomial. See Assignment 3
        Throws:
        PolyException - A polynomial definition error.
        OperatorException - An operator error.

     throws PolyException,

      • add

        public Poly add(Poly that)
        Adds the coefficients of two polynomials together and returns a new Poly containing the result of this addition.
        Parameters:
        that - The Poly to add to this Poly.
        Returns:
        The new Poly that results from adding that Poly to this Poly.

        public void copy(Poly that)
        Parameters:

      • diff

        public Poly diff()
        Returns a differentiated version of this Poly. The new Poly has a degree one smaller than that of the source Poly.
        Returns:
        a differentiated version of this Poly.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Poly that)
        Returns whether this Poly object and another Poly object are the same object, or contain equivalent coeffs.
        Parameters:
        that - The Poly to compare this Poly to.
        Returns:
        true if this Poly and that Poly are the same object or contain the equivalent coeffs, false otherwise.

      • evalAt

        public Rational evalAt(Rational x)
        Evaluates a polynomial given an x value and returns the result of that evaluation. Uses the Horner rule to evaluate the polynomial using only the term coefficients, rather than calling the int evalAt method for each int. Uses int values.
        Parameters:
        x - The value to substitute for x in the polynomial.
        Returns:
        The result of substituting the value x for x in the polynomial.

      • evalAt

        public double evalAt(int x)
        Evaluates a polynomial given an x value and returns the result of that evaluation. Uses the Horner rule to evaluate the polynomial using only the term coefficients, rather than calling the int evalAt method for each int. Uses int values.
        Parameters:
        x - The value to substitute for x in the polynomial.
        Returns:
        The result of substituting the value x for x in the polynomial.

      • toStringFull

        public java.lang.String toStringFull()
